replies.bodyText: Added check around all log.fine() statements that did not have check.

replies.bodyText:
FWIW, I don't think its always needed.  Its mostly just to avoid paying the cost of string building, especially when the logs contain Object.toString() calls (or similar), and especially when in a loop.
But it never hurts to have it, so I'm OK with adding it everywhere.

timeline.message:
Issue #1504 - add isLoggable checks around log.fine() statements

Signed-off-by: Mike Schroeder <mschroed@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: I think @punktilious requested to add this one back in "to avoid deadlock issues in case the same id appears in another bundle", but I'm hoping someone can explain it to me because I'm not sure I get it.
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText:
here is the problematic scenario:
within single transaction bundle:
bundle 1:
PUT A
PUT B

within a separate transaction bundle:
bundle 2:
PUT B
PUT A

the timing problem would be:

bundle 1 arrives first, it goes through entries and when it hits PUT A it locks A
bundle 2 arrives very soon afterward, and it starts processing the PUT B before bundle 1's PUT B (locking B)
deadlock
replies.author: lmsurpre
